Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the effectiveness of boiling orange peels with cayenne pepper in clearing mucus and protecting against COVID-19. There is no scientific evidence to support this claim.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient scientific evidence to support the effectiveness of boiling orange peels with cayenne pepper in clearing mucus and protecting against COVID-19.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that mucus is the main problem and where the virus lives, without providing any evidence to support this assumption.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts scientific facts by suggesting that boiling orange peels with cayenne pepper can protect against COVID-19. There is no scientific evidence to support this claim.
Understate: There is no understatement bias present in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by providing incorrect information and spelling errors, indicating a lack of credibility and reliability.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not provide any alternative explanations.
